Posts.Content: Please join us this Tuesday night in our advanced cancer caregivers virtual support group - especially those of you we have not heard from for a while. How are you faring - let us know ... ? If you are a caregiver for someone with advanced cancer, or you know anyone who is, please let them know about this group. And we welcome the recently bereaved. Our peer moderators have lived as caregivers to advanced cancer patients and also lost partners to cancer. AnCan's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group meets 8 p.m. Eastern time on both the first and third Tuesdays of the month. The groups are FREE & DROP-IN; join online or by telephone - you can find the instructions for joining at the end of the message. The meeting is a gentle, supportive, upbeat, peer-led space to talk - or just listen - about caregiving for any type of advanced cancer. We talk about whatever you wish to discuss - it is your time and space to talk about any- and everything caregiver related. We also welcome those who have recently lost loved one to discuss coping strategies. Renata Louwers, Debra Swiderski and Susan Lahaie co-moderate. Joining instructions are below; you can phone in or join via computer with just audio or audio plus video. All are welcome - it's free and drop-in! Whilst free & drop-in, we do encourage you to make a tax-deductible donation; or, at a minimum, sign up to donate to Answer Cancer Foundation when you shop on Amazon. You can sign up here Amazon Smile - it costs you nothing! We hope to talk with you soon; please e-mail us with any questions. For more information please visit our website www.ancan.org. If you have specific questions about the caregiver's group, you can reach me at renata@ancan.org. You can reach AnCan for more general questions at info@ancan.org. --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS ONLINE Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking First time using GoToMeeting? Do a quick system check: https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 other national local access codes are available - please e-mail me. Posts.Title: Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group - Tue, Dec 18 @ 8 pm EST

Posts.Content: Speaking Freely Virtual Support Group - Thursday, April 18 8 pm Eastern; 7 pm Central; 6 pm Mountain; 5 pm Pacific; 2 pm Hawaii Thursday evening, April 18th at 8pm EST, we discuss 'time' and other important subjects in a men-only environment. The format is informal, the conversation enlightening and encouraging. Speaking Freely is a support group for men with cancer, any cancer. It is a place for us to open up without being judged. Every man there has cancer and every man there has fears. You will be among friends that want to help. The perception of time is very subjective. A month has passed since our last gathering, but it feels like just last week. We face this paradox while waiting for labs or the results of labs or our next treatment. At times it seems as if our lives are out of control and spinning wildly only to be followed by a turtle, slowly crawling across the ground and the day will never end. How has your perception of time changed since you heard those life changing words "You have cancer"? The requirement to make a decision, the rush of trying to find information that applies to your circumstances and determine your best course of action while waiting for tests and their results. Hurry up and Wait. Please join us at 8pm EST on the 3rd Thursday of each month and let your voice support your brothers. JOINING INSTRUCTIONS Use your preferred method: ONLINE - AnCan Barniskis Room Please join our meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone. Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). A USB headset is recommended for the best sound quality. To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9373 Australia +61 2 9091 7603 Access Code: 222-583-973

Posts.Title: Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group - TONIGHT 1/8 8pm EST

Posts.Content: Speaking Freely Virtual Support Group - Thursday, May 16 @ 8 pm Eastern; 7 pm Central; 6 pm Mountain; 5 pm Pacific; 2 pm Hawaii Discuss all the non-medical aspects of living with cancer ... join us tonight! Speaking Freely is a support group for men with cancer, any cancer. It is a place for us to talk without being judged. Every man present has cancer ... you'll be among friends. We help each other and in doing so, we help ourselves. You have Cancer. Not the little "c"ancer like a magazine article. You have the big "C"ancer. The difference? Its now personal - you own cancer. Doctors, nurses, physicians assistants, lab techs and a host of other medical professionals will help with the medical side, the technical side of dealing with the seemingly unending events that you have been thrust into ..... they will explain the terms and test and results. They don't help much with the rest of your life ...... the unknown, the emotional roller coaster we received a front row ticket to ride. The concern about how to provide for your family, the aching fear you won't walk your daughter down the isle. The sense of loss in not feeling well enough to play with your grandson or the unfairness of not being able to play with your son. The embarrassment of incontinence, the shame of ED, the loss of intimacy with your partner. The format is informal, the conversation enlightening and encouraging. Please join us at 8pm EDT on the 3rd Thursday of each month and let your voice support your brothers. JOINING INSTRUCTIONS ONLINE Please join our meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone. Paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). A USB headset is recommended for the best sound quality. To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9373 Australia +61 2 9091 7603 For other countries, check http://www.ancan.org/joining-instructions/ Access Code: 222-583-973
Posts.Title: Men-only 'Speaking Freely' Virtual Group - TONIGHT, 5/16 @ 8pm EDT

Posts.Content: If diagnosed even recently with one of a host of diseases, including breast & prostate cancer and many pulmonary conditions, and you frequented Lower Manhattan/ NW Brooklyn after the WTC collapsed in 2001, you may be entitled to both healthcare assistance and compensation through the 9-11 WTC Healthcare Fund and Victims' Compensation Fund. People who responded &/or lived and worked in Lower Manhattan during and after the Towers collapsed may be entitled to assistance with their medical costs and compensation. Many of these folks were diagnosed several years later and may have moved away, while First Responders visited from all parts of the country. Since only 90,000 claims have been processed and some 450,000 were impacted, a large number remain and many are unaware of their benefits. And many are men living with prostate cancer - unless their medical team were sharp enough to pick it up in the intake, they would never know their rights. Here's the link to our AnCan Webinar from Monday - https://ancan.org/listen-to-our-9-11-webinar-on-accessing-health... AnCan has no financial interest, nor stands to gain any financial benefit from promoting this message ....
Posts.Title: Were you regularly in Lower Manhattan post-9/11 .... ? $$$

Posts.Content: FREE, DROP-IN WOMEN'S VIRTUAL, LIVE BREAST CANCER SUPPORT GROUP Thursday, Jan 3 - 8 pm EDT, 7 pm CDT, 6 pm MDT, 5 pm PDT We recognize many women and their caregivers want to attend a BCa support group ... but 'stuff' gets in the way! no group within easy geographical reach kids or elderly parents don't afford the time physical disability makes it hard to travel not so comfortable in a room with many others Answer Cancer Foundation (501c3), home of peer-led virtual support groups, hosts our WOMEN"S BREAST CANCER SUPPORT GROUP on the 1st & 3rd Thursdays of every month at 8 pm EST and invites you to participate .... dial-in or join online - see below. No fee, no registration. This group is totally interactive with audio and optional video connection. Our women's breast cancer group is moderated by Helen Tomasko, a long-term survivor of complex disease; Helen has moderated a breast cancer survivors support group at Ann's Place in Danbury, CT for several years. Our virtual group welcomes all survivors and their caregivers. We recognize BCa comes in all shapes and sizes. This group welcomes all - right now we only have numbers for a single group but as with other conditions, AnCan will readily split into more focused groups as participants present themselves. AnCan is also proud to sponsor a male breast cancer group in partnership with the Male Breast Cancer Coalition. That group meets every 4th Thursday - next meeting will be on Thursday, Jan 28, 2019 at 6 pm Eastern. For more information please visit: https://ancan.org Contact: Helen Tomasko helent@ancan.org, or Rick Davis info@ancan.org +1 415 505 0924 --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS Answer Cancer Meeting Room ONLINE Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP); to minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking First GoToMeeting? Do a quick system check: https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 Other national local access codes are available - please check here Access Code: 222-583-973
Posts.Title: AnCan Women's Live Virtual BCa Support Group ... Thu Mar 7 8pm EST

Posts.Content: Speaking Freely - men-only virtual cancer support group Thur. 2/21 @ 8 pm EST. 7 pm CST, 6 pm MST, 5 pm PST This free, drop-in group is for all the issues beyond the treatment itself! Men are hardwired to 'Handle It', 'Solve the Problem' or 'Save the Day'. But what happens when we have to save ourselves? When something so unexpected occurs that we freeze or our mind refuses to acknowledge what we have been told? When our definition of what we are is so challenged and shaken to our core? Speaking Freely is a support group for men with cancer, any cancer. It is a place for us to bare our souls and discuss our fears without being judged. Every man there has cancer and every man there has fears. You will be among friends that want to help. Please join us online or by phone for the 2nd gathering, Thursday 2/21 and let your voice support your brothers. JOINING INSTRUCTIONS AnCan Barniskis Room ONLINE Use your preferred method: Please join our meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone. Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). A USB headset is recommended for the best sound quality. To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking PHONE You can also dial in using your phone. Posts.Content: Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group - Tuesday, Mar 5 @ 5pm PST, 6pm MST, 7pm CST, 8pm EST Hello Everyone, Please join us this Tuesday (Feb. 19) night for our advanced cancer caregivers virtual support group. In the absence of our fearless leader, Renata Louwers , who is swishing her grass skirt and sipping mai-tai's on tropical Maui, her trusty co-moderators Debra Swiderslki and Susan Lahaie will selflessly step-in from the Eastern cold - actually Susan may be 'swishing' in the S. Pacific too so Rick Davis may be required from recently warmer Deep Southern Arizona! If you are a caregiver for someone with advanced cancer, or you know anyone who is, please let them know about this group. And we welcome the recently bereaved. Our peer moderators have both lived as caregivers to advanced cancer patients and also lost partners to cancer. Answer Cancer's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group meets 8 p.m. Eastern time (5p Pacific) on both the first and third Tuesdays of the month. AnCan's caregiver meeting is a gentle, supportive, upbeat, peer-led space to talk - or just listen - about caregiving for any type of advanced cancer. We talk about whatever you wish to discuss - it is your time and space to talk about any- and everything caregiver related. We also welcome those who have recently lost loved one to discuss coping strategies. Renata Louwers, Debra Swiderski and Susan Lahaie co-moderate. Joining instructions are below; you can phone in or join via computer with just audio or audio plus video. All are welcome - it's free and drop-in! Whilst free & drop-in, we do encourage you to make a tax-deductible donation if you are able to; or to sign up to donate to the Answer Cancer Foundation when you shop on Amazon. You can sign up here Amazon Smile - it costs you nothing! We hope to talk with you soon; please e-mail us with any questions. For more information please visit our website www.ancan.org. If you have specific questions about the caregiver's group, you can reach me at renata@ancan.org. You can reach AnCan for more general questions at info@ancan.org. We hope to talk with you soon! Onward & upwards ... Posts.Content: Advanced Cancer Caregivers & Recently Bereaved Virtual Support Group, Tuesday, Dec 3 5pm PST; 6pm MST; 7pm CST; 8pm EST Please join us tonight in our advanced cancer caregivers virtual support group meeting - especially those of you we have not heard from for a while. How are you faring - let us know ... ? If you are a caregiver for someone with advanced cancer, or you know anyone who is, please let them know about this group. And we welcome the recently bereaved. Our peer moderators have lived as caregivers to advanced cancer patients and also lost partners to cancer. AnCan's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group meets 8 p.m. Eastern time on both the first and third Tuesdays of the month. The groups are FREE & DROP-IN; join online or by telephone - you can find the instructions for joining at the end of the message. The meeting is a gentle, supportive, upbeat, peer-led space to talk - or just listen - about caregiving for any type of advanced cancer. We talk about whatever you wish to discuss - it is your time and space to talk about any- and everything caregiver related. We also welcome those who have recently lost loved one to discuss coping strategies. Renata Louwers, Debra Swiderski and Susan Lahaie co-moderate. Joining instructions are below; you can phone in or join via computer with just audio or audio plus video. All are welcome - it's free and drop-in! Whilst free & drop-in, we do encourage you to make a tax-deductible donation; or, at a minimum, sign up to donate to Answer Cancer Foundation when you shop on Amazon. You can sign up here Amazon Smile - it costs you nothing! We hope to talk with you soon; please e-mail us with any questions. For more information please visit our website www.ancan.org. If you have specific questions about the caregiver's group, you can reach me at renata@ancan.org. You can reach AnCan for more general questions at info@ancan.org. --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS ONLINE Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking First time using GoToMeeting? Do a quick system check: https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 other national local access codes are available - please e-mail me. Access Code: 222-583-973

Posts.Content: Join us tonight @ 8 pm EDT to discuss 'The Language of Cancer' in our AnCan men-only, Speaking Freely virtual support group. This open to men with ANY type of cancers! Do 'fighting', war-inspired words describe ... or do they offend you? See what Howard Wolinsky and also Prof. Richard Wassersug had to say about this on Medscape and in the NY Times and the UK's Guardian: https://www.medpagetoday.com/hematologyoncology/prostatecancer/56091 https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/mar/22/saying-you... https://www.nytimes.com/2007/03/27/health/27case.html Let us know in person tonight ...FREE & DROP-IN! JOINING INSTRUCTIONS - ONLINE or PHONE Online: Please enter our AnCan Barniskis Virtual Meeting Room from your computer, tablet or smartphone; paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). Posts.Title: The Language of Cancer - discuss TONIGHT in men-only Virtual Support Group

Posts.Content: CANCER GENETICS 101 – a (Very) Basic Primer ..... Everything you always wanted to know but didn’t know how to ask! AnCan WEBINAR FIND RECORDING @ https://www.ancan.org/genetics-101 Presented by: Dr. William C. (Bill) Burhans, Emeritus Associate Professor Oncology Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center And joining for questions: David Marshak Manager, Patient Advocacy Foundation Medicine Inc. No scientific background required …. this talk targets the lay public addressing: What is DNA? What are genes and proteins? What is a mutation? How do mutations alter the function of proteins? How do mutations lead to cancer? How can mutations be exploited in cancer therapy? .... targeted therapies and personalized medicine What is genetic testing? ..... genetics vs. genomics testing; germline vs. somatic; solid tumor biopsies vs liquid biopsies Presentation slides available to download - https://www.ancan.org/genetics-101 PROFESSOR BILL BURHANS In 2013 Bill was diagnosed with advanced prostate cancer caused in part by an inherited mutation in the BRCA2 gene. His own research laid the foundations for current therapies that have contributed to some of his treatments. Bill serves on AnCan’s Board of Directors and Board of Advisors. Edited January 30, 2019 at 10:12 am
Posts.Title: CANCER GENETICS 101 - AnCan WEBINAR ..... Recording available

Posts.Content: FREE, DROP-IN WOMEN'S VIRTUAL,LIVE BREAST CANCER SUPPORT GROUP Thursday, Dec 6 - 8 pm EDT, 7 pm CDT, 6 pm MDT, 5 pm PDT We recognize many women and their caregivers want to attend a BCa support group ... but 'stuff' gets in the way! - no group within easy geographical reach - kids or elderly parents don't afford the time - physical disability makes it hard to travel - not so comfortable in a room with many others Answer Cancer Foundation (501c3), home of peer-led virtual support groups, hosts our WOMEN"S BREAST CANCER SUPPORT GROUP on the 1st Thursday of every month at 8 pm EST and invites you to participate .... dial-in or join online - see below. No fee, no registration. The women's breast cancer group is moderated by Helen Tomasko, a long-term survivor of complex disease; Helen has moderated a breast cancer survivors support group at Ann's Place in Danbury, CT for several years. Our virtual group welcomes all survivors and their caregivers. We recognize BCa comes in all shapes and sizes. This group welcomes all - right now we only have numbers for a single group but as with other conditions, AnCan will readily split into more focused groups as participants present themselves. AnCan is also proud to sponsor a newly formed male breast cancer group in partnership with the Male Breast Cancer Coalition. That group meets every 4th Thursday - next meeting will be on Thursday, Jan 28, 2019 at 6 pm Eastern. Posts.Title: Adv. Cancer Caregivers Virtual Support Group - Tue, April 16 at 8 pm EDT

Posts.Content: Thursday, Jan 17 at 8 pm Eastern, 7 pm Central, 6 pm Mountain, 5 pm Pacific - mark your calendar! MEN ONLY virtual support group ... audio/visual in real time - join online or by phone. FREE & DROP-IN When the 'C' word barges into your 'man cave', reality takes on new dimensions. Cancer disrupts many of life's comfortable parameters - it invades work, play, family, intimate relationships and friendships ....just about everything! Being able to talk to someone who has been there is a blessing and that's what Rich and AnCan (www.ancan.org) offer in a safe, warm space suitable for man-talk and speaking freely! The group is open to all cancers. We don't discuss medicine, protocols and treatments - rather all the other issues you have to deal with living with cancer. To start, the virtual group meets every 3rd Thursday of the month. Moderator:The mellifluous Rich Jackson Questions ... info@ancan.org PS .. and please check out our other virtual groups https://www.ancan.org/support-calls --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS Answer Cancer Meeting Room ONLINE Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP); to minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking First GoToMeeting? Do a quick system check: https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 Other national local access codes are available - please check here Access Code: 222-583-973
Posts.Title: NEW VIRTUAL GROUP ..... 'SPEAKING FREELY' - Thu Jan 17 @ 8pm Eastern

Posts.Content: FREE & DROP-IN The question for the evening is "How would you describe your mental health?". Looking in a mirror is one of the hardest things we have to do. Sometimes the scariest thing we have to deal with is what is looking back from that mirror. Being honest with what we see is vital to our moving forward and prospering. Let's take a few minutes before the call and give ourselves a good look. We have been challenged by our doctors, insurance companies and our own bodies. Lets make sure our heads are screwed on straight and in our corner. When we discuss our experiences, we empower ourselves and help other men with the issues they face. Our shared knowledge makes us more powerful, more informed and better able to face the day. You will have time talk if you wish. I found talking about the things bothering me allowed the other men on the call to help me with their knowledge and wisdom. You will hear stories and questions from other men as well. Some of us just want to listen and comment once in a while. Please join us on Wednesday night on a call with men just like you. Men with cancer, any cancer. Only men on the call, no judgement, no hiding. You maybe newly diagnosed or a survivor with years under your belt, you are welcome to join us. We want to hear your voice. You are not alone. John Teisberg Founder, The Reluctant Brotherhood email: john@thereluctantbrotherhood.org website: thereluctantbrotherhood.org PS. Please let other men with cancer know about this, they are not alone. They can check us out and there’s no commitment. PPS. Check out the technical calls at: ancan.org ; there are a whole bunch of cool calls you can join there. JOINING INSTRUCTIONS Use your preferred method: ONLINE Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). A USB headset is recommended for the best sound quality. To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking PHONE You can also dial in using your phone. United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 Access Code: 222-583-973 ................ About the call: This is a simple conference call where we learn, talk about ideas, give and get opinions and figure out how to support each other. We are not doctors, we are the men who are in the game for real. We are the ones who are actually living with the cancer. This is not a very technical call because we talk about what is going on inside our hearts and minds. We poke around with our emotional lives, the unmeasurable stuff. We work with things 'men' are not supposed to talk about. We discuss emotions, those raw feelings we all have and usually keep to ourselves. All of them are on the table. Speaking about feelings and emotions is not in the comfort zone of most American men. Although it seems risky, these are the conversations most of us are dying to have. The guys on the call are friendly survivors who are ready to talk with men in the same boat. .............. What happens on the call? Usually there is a lot of laughing on the call because we tease each other and enjoy each others company. Humor is one way to approach the anger, fear, joy and sadness we all carry. We talk about pain, good reports, our families, death, sex, stupid things we do, money, fun things we have done, death and dying, tell crappy jokes and more. We do, however, stay away from politics. Although there is a fair amount of laughing the call is tempered with deadly serious conversations. We are all dealing with changes we do not want. We’ve been dealt a crappy hand and you know there are powerful repercussions for that. There are not many people a guy can really talk to about what’s happening inside. Often a guy simply wants advice about how to handle stuff. You will get good opinions from other men who are going through the same kind of mischief. You might pick up an idea that works for you, for where you are on your journey, from the call. Sometimes a good rant makes your troubles get more ‘right sized’. Everybody enjoys a well crafted rant. At the end of those we are all usually smiling because we’ve all run into the same sort of problems. Anger, sadness, fear, confusion, joy, discoveries and frustration are all welcome here. These conversations are rich and sometimes very dark. You don’t have to talk, you can simply listen if you want. Talking about numbers and procedures is kept to a minimum. We also know these things are going to be part of our conversation because they are important. The moderator’s job is to keep us on track talking about the unmeasurable things, our feelings. ................... When exactly is the call? Every Wednesday evening.Start time: 8 pm EST, 7 pm CST, 6 pm MST, 5 pm PST.
Posts.Title: The Inner Conversation Virtual Support Group - TONIGHT 10/24 8 pm EDT

Posts.Content: AnCan's Men-Only 'Speaking Freely' Virtual Cancer Support Group - Th 3/21 8 pm EDT, 7 pm CDT, 6 pm MDT, 5 pm PDT Speaking Freely is AnCan's men-only cancer support group for any type of cancer. We create a safe, secure support space for men to speak openly around issues that trouble them arising from their diagnosis. You will be among friends eager to provide support. This month we'll be discussing words! Words have meaning ..... each of us has heard the 'Battle Call' to 'Fight Fight Fight' and 'You are a Survivor' - Thursday evening, March 21st at 8pm EST, we will be discussing various words and phrases that are common in the cancer community (and any serious illness setting). We will also have a guest, Howard Wolinsky. Howard is a journalist, writing articles for MedPage Today and other medical publications about his PCa journey. Howard had asked our Founder, Rick Davis a question about the use of different words to describe our journey. Rick invited him to join and allow us to answer the question ourselves. Howard, being a writer, would like to incorporate our responses in a future article or two. With your permission, he would like to quote some of the conversation. This permission is yours individually to give or withhold. Here are some links to Howards work: https://www.medpagetoday.com/hematologyoncology/prostatecancer/63251 Most recent: https://www.medpagetoday.com/hematologyoncology/prostatecancer/78246 https://www.medpagetoday.com/special-reports/apatientsjourney/76105 And: https://www.everydayhealth.com/prostate-cancer/living-with/prost... Please join us at 8pm EST on the 3rd Thursday of each month and let your voice support your brothers. JOINING INSTRUCTIONS - ONLINE or PHONE Online: Please enter our AnCan Barniskis Virtual Meeting Room from your computer, tablet or smartphone; paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). A USB headset is recommended for the best sound quality. To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking Phone: You can also dial in using your phone. United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 Access Code: 222-583-973
